body: Using `slice.startOr(0)` works because the beginning of the range is inclusive. If you'd like, I can make `start` explicitly optional for the purpose of schema matching, but I thought it might be easier to read to avoid the four-way branching.
body_html: Using slice.startOr(0) works because the beginning of the range is inclusive. If you'd like, I can make start explicitly optional for the purpose of schema matching, but I thought it might be easier to read to avoid the four-way branching.
body_text: Using slice.startOr(0) works because the beginning of the range is inclusive. If you'd like, I can make start explicitly optional for the purpose of schema matching, but I thought it might be easier to read to avoid the four-way branching.
